verses.verse: (The Divine Shepherd) A Psalm of David. (Isa 40.11; 1 Pet 2.25) The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
(Ezek 34.14; Rev 7.17) He makes me lie down in green pastures; he leads me beside still waters; (Heb waters of rest)
(Ps 5.8; 19.7) he restores my soul. (Or life) He leads me in right paths (Or paths of righteousness) for his nameâ€™s sake.

(Job 3.5; Ps 27.1; 138.7; Isa 43.2) Even though I walk through the darkest valley, (Or the valley of the shadow of death) I fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
(Ps 16.5; 31.19; 78.19; 92.10) You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies; you anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows.

(Ps 25.7, 10; 27.4-6) Surely (Or Only) goodness and mercy (Or kindness) shall follow me all the days of my life, and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD my whole life long. (Heb for length of days)
